a href.aria-roles:
Roles: button, checkbox, menuitem, menuitemcheckbox, menuitemradio, option, radio, switch, tab or treeitem

DPub Roles: doc-backlink, doc-biblioref, doc-glossref or doc-noteref

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

It is NOT RECOMMENDED to use aria-disabled="true" on an a element with an href attribute.

NOTE
If a link needs to be programmatically communicated as "disabled", remove the href attribute.

a !href.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

area href.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the link role.

area !href.aria-roles:
Roles: button or link

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

article.aria-roles:
Roles: application, document, feed, main, none, presentation or region

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

aside.aria-roles:
Roles: feed, none, note, presentation, region or search

DPub Roles: doc-dedication, doc-example, doc-footnote, doc-pullquote or doc-tip

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

autonomous custom element.role:
Role exposed from author defined ElementInternals

Otherwise role=generic
autonomous custom element.aria-roles:
If role defined by ElementInternals, no role

Otherwise, any role

Naming Prohibited if exposed as the generic role, or if exposed as another role which prohibits naming.

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

b.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

bdi.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

bdo.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

blockquote.aria-roles:
Any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

body.aria-roles:
No role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes.

button.aria-roles:
Roles: checkbox, combobox, link, menuitem, menuitemcheckbox, menuitemradio, option, radio, switch or tab

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

caption.aria-roles:
No role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes.

code.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

data.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

del.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

details.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the group role.

dfn.aria-roles:
Any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

dialog.aria-roles:
Role: alertdialog

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the dialog role.

div.aria-roles:
Any role unless a direct child of a dl element. Then only presentation or none.

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

em.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

fieldset.aria-roles:
Roles: none, presentation or radiogroup

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

figure.aria-roles:
If the figure has no figcaption descendant:
Any role

If the figure has a figcaption descendant:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

footer.role:
If not a descendant of an article, aside, main, nav or section element, or an element with role=article, complementary, main, navigation or region then role=contentinfo

Otherwise, role=generic
footer.aria-roles:
Roles: group, presentation or none

DPub Role: doc-footnote

Naming Prohibited if exposed as generic.

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

form.aria-roles:
Roles: or none, presentation or search

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

NOTE

A form is not exposed as a landmark region unless it has been provided an accessible name.

form-associated custom element.role:
Role exposed from author defined ElementInternals

Otherwise role=generic
form-associated custom element.aria-roles:
If role defined by ElementInternals, no role

Otherwise, form-related roles: button, checkbox, combobox, listbox, progressbar, group, radio, radiogroup, searchbox, slider, spinbutton, switch or textbox

Naming Prohibited if exposed as the generic role.

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

h1 to h6.role: role=heading, aria-level = the number in the element's tag name
h1 to h6.aria-roles:
Roles: none, presentation or tab

DPub Role: doc-subtitle

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

header.role:
If not a descendant of an article, aside, main, nav or section element, or an element with role=article, complementary, main, navigation or region then role=banner

Otherwise, role=generic
header.aria-roles:
Roles: group, none or presentation

Naming Prohibited if exposed as generic.

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

hgroup.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

hr.aria-roles:
Roles: none or presentation

DPub Role: doc-pagebreak

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the separator role.

i.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

img alt.aria-roles:
Roles: button, checkbox, link, menuitem, menuitemcheckbox, menuitemradio, option, progressbar, radio, scrollbar, separator, slider, switch, tab or treeitem

DPub Role: doc-cover

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

img alt=''.aria-roles: No role or aria-* attributes except aria-hidden="true"

img !alt.aria-roles:
If no accessible name is provided via other img naming methods (e.g., aria-labelledby, aria-label): No role, and no aria-* attributes except aria-hidden="true"

Otherwise, if the img has an author defined accessible name, see img with alt="some text".

input type=button.aria-roles:
Roles: checkbox, combobox, link, menuitem, menuitemcheckbox, menuitemradio, option, radio, switch or tab

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

input type=checkbox.aria-roles:
Roles: menuitemcheckbox, option or switch; button if used with aria-pressed

Authors MUST NOT use the aria-checked attribute on input type=checkbox elements.

Otherwise, any global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

NOTE

The HTML checked attribute can be used instead of the aria-checked attribute for menuitemcheckbox, option or switch roles when used on type=checkbox.

input type=email !list.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the textbox role.

input type=image.aria-roles:
Roles: link, menuitem, menuitemcheckbox, menuitemradio, radio or switch

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

input type=number.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the spinbutton role.

input type=radio.aria-roles:
Role: menuitemradio

Authors MUST NOT use the aria-checked attribute on input type=radio elements.

Otherwise, any global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

NOTE

The HTML checked attribute can be used instead of the aria-checked attribute for the menuitemradio role when used on type=radio.

input type=range.aria-roles:
No role

Authors SHOULD NOT use the aria-valuemax or aria-valuemin attributes on input type=range.

Otherwise, any global aria-* attributes and any other aria-* attributes applicable to the slider role.

input type=reset.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the button role.

input type=search !list.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the searchbox role.

input type=submit.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the button role.

input type=tel !list.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the textbox role.

input type=text !list.aria-roles:
Roles: combobox, searchbox or spinbutton

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

input type=url !list.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the textbox role.

ins.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

li.aria-roles:
Roles: menuitem, menuitemcheckbox, menuitemradio, option, none, presentation, radio, separator, tab or treeitem

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

Authors SHOULD NOT use the following deprecated DPub Roles: doc-biblioentry, doc-endnote.

main.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the main role.

math.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the math role.

menu.aria-roles:
Roles: group, listbox, menu, menubar, none, presentation, radiogroup, tablist, toolbar or tree

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

Authors SHOULD NOT use deprecated directory role.

meter.aria-roles:
No role

Authors SHOULD NOT use the aria-valuemax or aria-valuemin attributes on meter elements.

Otherwise, any global aria-* attributes.

nav.aria-roles:
Roles: menu, menubar, none, presentation or tablist

DPub Roles: doc-index, doc-pagelist or doc-toc

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

ol.aria-roles:
Roles: group, listbox, menu, menubar, none, presentation, radiogroup, tablist, toolbar or tree

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

Authors SHOULD NOT use deprecated directory role.

optgroup.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the group role.

option el-list.aria-roles:
No role

Authors SHOULD NOT use the aria-selected attribute on the option element.

Global aria-* attributes and any other aria-* attributes applicable to the option role.

option el-datalist.aria-roles:
No role

Authors SHOULD NOT use the aria-selected attribute on the option element.

Global aria-* attributes and any other aria-* attributes applicable to the option role.

output.aria-roles:
Any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

p.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

pre.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

progress.aria-roles:
No role

Authors SHOULD NOT use the aria-valuemax attribute on progress elements.

Otherwise, any global aria-* attributes and any other aria-* attributes applicable to the progressbar role.

q.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

samp.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

section.role:
role=region if the section element has an accessible name

Otherwise, no corresponding role
section.aria-roles:
Roles: alert, alertdialog, application, banner, complementary, contentinfo, dialog, document, feed, group, log, main, marquee, navigation, none, note, presentation, search, status or tabpanel

DPub Roles: doc-abstract, doc-acknowledgments, doc-afterword, doc-appendix, doc-bibliography, doc-chapter, doc-colophon, doc-conclusion, doc-credit, doc-credits, doc-dedication, doc-endnotes, doc-epigraph, doc-epilogue, doc-errata, doc-example, doc-foreword, doc-glossary, doc-index, doc-introduction, doc-notice, doc-pagelist, doc-part, doc-preface, doc-prologue, doc-pullquote, doc-qna, doc-toc

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

select !multiple size<1.aria-roles:
Role: menu

Authors SHOULD NOT use the aria-multiselectable attribute on a select element.

Otherwise, any global aria-* attributes and any other aria-* attributes applicable to the combobox or menu role.

select multiple.aria-roles:
No role

Authors SHOULD NOT use the aria-multiselectable attribute on a select element.

Otherwise, any global aria-* attributes and any other aria-* attributes applicable to the listbox role.

select size>1.aria-roles:
No role

Authors SHOULD NOT use the aria-multiselectable attribute on a select element.

Otherwise, any global aria-* attributes and any other aria-* attributes applicable to the listbox role.

small.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

span.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

strong.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

sub.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

summary.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the button role.

sup.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

SVG.role: role=graphics-document as defined by SVG AAM
SVG.aria-roles:
Any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

table.aria-roles:
Any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

tbody.aria-roles:
Any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

textarea.aria-roles:
No role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the textbox role.

tfoot.aria-roles:
Any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

thead.aria-roles:
Any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

time.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

td.role:
role=cell if the ancestor table element is exposed as a role=table

role=gridcell if the ancestor table element is exposed as a role=grid or treegrid

No corresponding role if the ancestor table element is not exposed as a role=table, grid or treegrid
td.aria-roles:
No role if the ancestor table element has role=table, grid, or treegrid; otherwise any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

th.role:
role=columnheader, rowheader or cell if the ancestor table element is exposed as a role=table

role=columnheader, rowheader or gridcell if the ancestor table element is exposed as a role=grid or treegrid

No corresponding role if the ancestor table element is not exposed as a role=table, grid or treegrid
th.aria-roles:
No role if the ancestor table element has role=table, grid, or treegrid; otherwise any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

tr.aria-roles:
No role if the ancestor table element has role=table, grid, or treegrid; otherwise any role

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

u.aria-roles:
Any role

Naming Prohibited

Otherwise, global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

ul.aria-roles:
Roles: group, listbox, menu, menubar, none, presentation, radiogroup, tablist, toolbar or tree

Global aria-* attributes and any aria-* attributes applicable to the allowed roles.

Authors SHOULD NOT use the deprecated directory role.
